nodes.bodyText: Will the DESTROYED tasks show up in REST so that we can add an assertion to make sure they are not UNASSIGNED?

The framework doesn't actually explicitly write the DESTROYED state to the status backing store, it just writes a null-valued record: 
  
    
      kafka/connect/runtime/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/connect/storage/KafkaStatusBackingStore.java
    
    
         Line 285
      in
      d3f9cb5
    
    
    
    

        
          
           final byte[] value = status.state() == ConnectorStatus.State.DESTROYED ? null : serialize(status); 
        
    
  


That information is surfaced via the REST API by the lack of the presence of that task in the status info for the connector. So verifying exactly the number of tasks should also verify that the expected number of deleted tasks were removed from the status backing store.
Makes sense. And I kind of figured that is likely the reason for lack of explicit assertion there.
Invoked when the task is deleted because the connector tasks where reduced or the connector itself was deleted.
